home.name: Andrey Elyan
home.role: Senior Software Engineer | Node.js, TypeScript, NestJS, AWS, React | Microservices & CI/CD

about.title: About Me
about.intro: I'm Andrey, a developer passionate about transforming innovative ideas into digital solutions that impact millions of people!
about.journey: My journey began over 8 years ago when I discovered that code isn't just text - it's the language that connects dreams to reality. Since then, I've been building systems that process millions of transactions, optimize retail operations, and revolutionize customer experience.
about.achievements: üéØ Throughout my career, I've developed solutions that:
about.achievement1: ‚Ä¢ Process over 15 million RFID tags monthly
about.achievement2: ‚Ä¢ Reduce operational costs by up to 92%
about.achievement3: ‚Ä¢ Impact more than 4,000 stores across Brazil
about.achievement4: ‚Ä¢ Improve the experience of millions of customers
about.passion: üí° My passion? Transforming complex problems into elegant solutions! I love working with cutting-edge technologies - from serverless microservices to RFID systems that seem like science fiction, but are pure reality.
about.personality: üöÄ When I'm not coding, you'll find me exploring new technologies, participating in hackathons, or simply admiring how a line of code can change the world. I believe the best technology is the one people don't even notice exists - it just works perfectly.
about.mission: üéØ My mission is to create solutions that not only work, but inspire. Every project is an opportunity to learn, innovate, and leave a technological legacy that makes a difference.

techStack.title: üõ†Ô∏è My Tech Playground
techStack.subtitle: Started hacking in Delphi in 2014, then migrated to the JavaScript world. Today I spend my time between NestJS microservices, React UIs, and cloud architectures with AWS Lambda, S3, Athena, DynamoDB, Kubernetes. Always seeking the next challenge ‚Äî from code to complex system design.

gbRastreio.title: GB Rastreio ‚Äì RFID Traceability Platform
gbRastreio.subtitle: Grupo Botic√°rio ‚Ä¢ Jan 2024 - Present ‚Ä¢ Backend/Cloud Lead
gbRastreio.description: End-to-end RFID solution for Grupo Botic√°rio to ensure inventory accuracy, improve traceability and reduce operational costs across distribution centers and factories.

challenge.title: Challenge & Context
challenge.problem: Grupo Botic√°rio faced lack of inventory visibility, product losses, and frequent inventory failures due to limited barcode/etiquette systems across
challenge.technical: High query performance and cost problems using DynamoDB-centric architecture for analytics workloads.

contribution.title: My Technical Contribution
contribution.architecture: Architecture Design: Led microservices architecture in NestJS with Clean Architecture + DDD
contribution.aws: AWS Strategy: Designed serverless workloads with Lambda, API Gateway, DynamoDB
contribution.migration: Data Migration: Proposed and implemented DynamoDB ‚Üí S3 + Athena migration for analytics
contribution.tagService: Tag Service: Built robust EPC generation and serialization system
contribution.security: Security: Implemented granular RBAC with JSONB policies (ABAC)
contribution.rfid: RFID Integration: Designed middleware for hardware communication
contribution.cicd: CI/CD Implementation: GitHub Actions + ArgoCD for automated deployments

scale.title: Scale & Performance
scale.item2: Hours ‚Üí Minutes: Analytics reports now ready in minutes vs hours

cost.title: Cost Optimization
cost.item1: Storage: moved historical analytics from DynamoDB to S3 Standard, cutting storage from ~US$ 500 ‚Üí ~US$ 46/month for 2 TB (~91% lower) or ~US$ 200 ‚Üí ~US$ 46 (~77%) vs Standard-IA
cost.item2: Query cost: with Athena at ~US$ 5/TB scanned and Parquet columnar compression, we reduced bytes scanned per report by ~12√ó, dropping cost from ~US$ 10 ‚Üí ~US$ 0.83 per query on a 2 TB dataset (~92% cheaper), saving ~US$ 1,000 ‚Üí ~US$ 83/month for ~100 queries
cost.item3: Outcome: separated OLTP from analytics, improved performance predictability, and achieved double-digit cost reductions while enabling richer historical reporting

dataLake.title: Data Lake Migration
dataLake.description: Separated OLTP from analytics by migrating historical data from DynamoDB to S3 + Athena with Parquet format. Achieved 12√ó compression ratio and columnar optimization for faster, cheaper queries.

tagService.title: RFID Tag Service
tagService.description: Built robust EPC generation and serialization system with batch processing, TTL management, and hardware integration for industrial RFID printers and readers.

challenge.problem: Lojas Renner needed to modernize the shopping experience and streamline payment processes across
